posts.post_content: They reprinted this card for one reason. They don't want the stupid almighty eldrazi to die to a wimpy [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade)or [Terminate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminate). So they reprinted a card that causes a huge set back if targeting an eldrazi, plain and simple. Because as much as Wizards my not have wanted removal in this set, you just gotta have some.
posts.html:
They reprinted this card for one reason. They don't want the stupid almighty eldrazi to die to a wimpy Doom Bladeor Terminate. So they reprinted a card that causes a huge set back if targeting an eldrazi, plain and simple. Because as much as Wizards my not have wanted removal in this set, you just gotta have some.

posts.post_content: Eh, I think I'd go with [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) myself, especially since Rise is all about "slowing the game down". 1 extra mana without the damage effect wouldn't hurt too much, especially since people rarely play amazing creatures on the first turn.

posts.post_content:
This card is awesome. Here is what Mark Rosewater has to say about it:  
  
***This was one of the first cards Brian put into the file once the idea of "battlecruiser Magic" was decided upon. Brian loved how the card was good at killing creatures but much painful when used against the giant creatures of the set. The card never left the file.***

Rating:

posts.post_content: Tournament winner, and possibly the best removal in Roe limited, as Florian Koch proved in his recent PT win. Would probably have been blacks best removal ever if it didnt have the non-black clause restriction but just the life loss (which can be mitigated with correct play, much like Vendetta's distant cousin [Swords to Plowshares](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swords to Plowshares)), due to its sleek 1cmc cost and instant speed.
